channel.title: Log Timer help
channel.description:
i need to make my log time longer... (if u w8 a while with out play u log out, that time) were do i go to change it?
317

item.title: Log Timer help
item.dc:creator: @Music8 Music8
item.description:
@Music8 wrote:

ok i checked it out but it didnt do anything… i delted case 202 but nuthin changed…

Read full topic

item.title: Log Timer help
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“iCreatedHorror, post:6, topic:349203”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=445573.msg3271056#msg3271056 date=1279207137]

What sort of timer is it? We can’t help you without any sort of code reference.

His idle-logout timer, for when a player goes AFK, ect. (not playing). He wants to make it longer then what it currently is. He said that, l2read. On topic: Lemme look through whatever I still have on my computer for it…again.

You’re a dick.

What sort of timer. For example, using TimerTask and Timer

timer.scheduleAtFixedRate(new TimerTask() { 
    public void run() {
     // Task here ... 
    } 
}, delay, period);

Or using 317 “boolean process” method.

if(someTimer = 0) {
    // Do shit
}

boolean process()
{
    ...
    someTimer--;
}

[/quote]
Sorry, Steve, I didn’t mean to come off like that. I just hate when people ask what their talking about when it appears fairly clear in their topic. My fault if you thought I was coming off like that.
Edit: Music, read THIS.
He tells how to remove the idle timer.[/quote]
It’s alrite mate, no problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Log Timer help
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:5, topic:349203”][quote author=iCreatedHorror link=topic=445573.msg3271051#msg3271051 date=1279206379]

What sort of timer is it? We can’t help you without any sort of code reference.

His idle-logout timer, for when a player goes AFK, ect. (not playing). He wants to make it longer then what it currently is. He said that, l2read. On topic: Lemme look through whatever I still have on my computer for it…again.
[/quote]
You’re a dick.

What sort of timer. For example, using TimerTask and Timer

timer.scheduleAtFixedRate(new TimerTask() { 
    public void run() {
     // Task here ... 
    } 
}, delay, period);

Or using 317 “boolean process” method.

[code]
if(someTimer = 0) {
// Do shit
}

boolean process()
{
…
someTimer–;
}
[/code][/quote]
Sorry, Steve, I didn’t mean to come off like that. I just hate when people ask what their talking about when it appears fairly clear in their topic. My fault if you thought I was coming off like that.
Edit: Music, read THIS.
He tells how to remove the idle timer.

Read full topic

His idle-logout timer, for when a player goes AFK, ect. (not playing). He wants to make it longer then what it currently is. He said that, l2read. On topic: Lemme look through whatever I still have on my computer for it…again.[/quote]
You’re a dick.

What sort of timer. For example, using TimerTask and Timer

timer.scheduleAtFixedRate(new TimerTask() { 
    public void run() {
     // Task here ... 
    } 
}, delay, period);

Or using 317 “boolean process” method.

if(someTimer = 0) {
    // Do shit
}

boolean process()
{
    ...

}
